intro: Cineraria cinia, commonly known as the common cineraria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features basal rosettes of silvery-gray, fuzzy leaves. Its flowers are borne on slender stems and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Cineraria cinia is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
